name: Prunarr Bridge
description: Jellyfin plugin for Prunarr integration. Manages symlinks via HTTP API. v2.0+ uses simplified design: symlink management only, no library management.
overview: Bridge between Prunarr and Jellyfin for managing symlinks

versions.changelog:
Version 2.0.0 - BREAKING CHANGES
- Simplified to symlink-only design (Single Responsibility Principle)
- Removed Virtual Folder management (Prunarr must handle this)
- Removed library scanning (Prunarr must handle this)
- Renamed endpoints: /leaving-soon/* â†’ /symlinks/*
- Removed /clear endpoint (use /remove for each item)
- Added /symlinks/list endpoint
- Removed AutoCreateVirtualFolder configuration
- Removed VirtualFolderName configuration
- Updated description and documentation

Migration Guide:
- Update API endpoints in Prunarr
- Prunarr must create libraries via Jellyfin API
- Prunarr must trigger scans after batch operations
- See API.md for complete migration guide

Version 1.0.4
- Updated to .NET 9.0 and Jellyfin 10.11.2
- Automated manifest updates with JPRM

Version 1.0.3
- Updated to .NET 9.0 and Jellyfin 10.11.2
- Automated manifest updates with JPRM

Fixed plugin registration
- Added missing configuration page HTML file
- Plugin now properly appears in Jellyfin plugin list
- Configuration UI now available with API key, symlink path, and virtual folder settings

Initial release
- HTTP API endpoints for managing 'Leaving Soon' items
- Automatic Virtual Folder creation and management
- Symlink creation for media files
- API key authentication
- Support for movies, TV shows, and mixed collections
